nodes.bodyText: NIT: Maybe this variable should be named addressesActiveVuln or something to that effect and have its values reversed in this function so that it matches the javadoc
I also find it quite confusing. In the theory in case there is a warning for an individual plugin, then the whole message should be displayed? I think this is actually doing the opposite?
NIT: Maybe this VersionNumber object should be constructed outside the loop. Although java might just optimize this away

nodes.bodyText:
NIT: Not used to such naming convention. I generally expect method starting with an action verb to do something. In this case if I call this method I expect it to fix the vulnerabilities.
💡 containsSecurityVulnerabilitiesFixes ?
